title: >>> Fatal ATTRACTION
body_text:
Records:
- Attendance: 33
- New Players: (4) Corey C, Sar.....
WAIT WAIT ... That's November 4th, 2005, better known as DODGEBALL XONE!
The 62nd Records
- Attendance: 5
The absolute lowest attendance ever, beating out DODGEBALL 45 which had 10.
- New Players: 0
- DODGEBALL 62 did not feature any regular team vs. team games.
- DODGEBALL 62 did not feature any rims, whether "Human" or "Letsche".
- DODGEBALL 62 featured the second ever
Dodgeball Battle Royal
, created by the one and only Steve Adams. The first battle royal, coined the "Kevin Megill Memorial", was held after the main match of DODGEBALL 39.
- Four of the five players that participated at DODGEBALL 62 also participated at DODGEBALL 45, now the second lowest attendance ever: Kevin Fitzpatrick, Alison Bertsch, Diana DiBuccio, and John Tronolone.
- For obvious reasons, DODGEBALL 62 had the fewest male players at a single event with 3. The previous record was held at DODGEBALL DAY 1 with 7.
- DODGEBALL 62 ended roughly 9:30pm, making it one of the shortest events in history.
The "FATAL" ATTRACTION!
An interesting change to the game these battle royals add. Rather than depending on teammates, your eyes, ears, and endurance are your closest allies. Without those, one becomes a sitting duck, ready to be destroyed by a single throw.
- You have
Jim Martin
, the light and agile dodger whose quickness certainly game him an edge.
- Next is
John Tronolone
, a man who has seen and done all in the game of dodgball. His experience was the key to his success.
- The fearless
Alison Bertsch
would use her strength and deflections as her part of her strategy.
- Powerhouse monster
Kevin Fitzpatrick
was a sure odds-on favorite to win; brute force, swift dodges, among many of his other talents.
- Rounding out the five would be veteran
Diana DiBuccio
, with the use of her hands would be her biggest asset.
The legendary John Tronolone started off as only he would have liked, securing the first two games of the first-ever Fatal Five-Way Elimination match-up. But his first victories were short lived as nemesis Kevin Fitzpatrick won the third and fourth games, tying it up with Tronolone. The next game however would favor John once again, taking the fifth battle royal game and improving his score to 3. But "Fitz" was no where near finished with his rival. He'd pick up his third win also taking game 6. Would the final battle prove one man's superiority?
In the final game of DODGEBALL 62, neither John nor Fitz would walk away victorious. Prodigy Jim Martin woud instead take home the gold, coming out the final winner of the 62nd dodgeball spectacular.
Simplified Version of the Battle Royal
Game 1: John wins
Game 2: John wins
Game 3: "Fitz" wins
Game 4: "Fitz wins
Game 5: John wins
Game 6: "Fitz" wins
Game 7: Jim wins
John Tronolone and Kevin Fitzpatrick tied in the Fatal Five-Way Dodgeball Battle Royal at DODGEBALL 62, both earning 3 victories. Jim Martin placed runner-up with 1 win. Neither Alison nor Diana earned a victory.
DODGEBALL LX3: WAR
How odd that DODGEBALL 62 was billed as "The Calm before the Storm". It appears as if that may have been true. But now it's on to serious business as dodgeball is set to be invaded come this Saturday night, November the 11th.
It is no secret that for weeks, even months, the dodgeball website and more-so dodgeball's own, has been verbally attacked by a bunch of unknowns. The one question perhaps on everyones' mind is
Who can it be?
It appears as if the answer to that will remain a mystery, at least until LX3.
Any developments to this story will be posted as soon as possible. Those that plan on attending, it is urged that you frequently check the dodgeball website, here at dodgeball.livejournal.com.
body_html:
Records:
- Attendance: 33
- New Players: (4) Corey C, Sar.....

WAIT WAIT ... That's November 4th, 2005, better known as DODGEBALL XONE!

The 62nd Records
- Attendance: 5
The absolute lowest attendance ever, beating out DODGEBALL 45 which had 10.
- New Players: 0
- DODGEBALL 62 did not feature any regular team vs. team games.
- DODGEBALL 62 did not feature any rims, whether "Human" or "Letsche".
- DODGEBALL 62 featured the second ever Dodgeball Battle Royal, created by the one and only Steve Adams. The first battle royal, coined the "Kevin Megill Memorial", was held after the main match of DODGEBALL 39.
- Four of the five players that participated at DODGEBALL 62 also participated at DODGEBALL 45, now the second lowest attendance ever: Kevin Fitzpatrick, Alison Bertsch, Diana DiBuccio, and John Tronolone.
- For obvious reasons, DODGEBALL 62 had the fewest male players at a single event with 3. The previous record was held at DODGEBALL DAY 1 with 7.
- DODGEBALL 62 ended roughly 9:30pm, making it one of the shortest events in history.


The "FATAL" ATTRACTION!
An interesting change to the game these battle royals add. Rather than depending on teammates, your eyes, ears, and endurance are your closest allies. Without those, one becomes a sitting duck, ready to be destroyed by a single throw.

- You have Jim Martin, the light and agile dodger whose quickness certainly game him an edge.
- Next is John Tronolone, a man who has seen and done all in the game of dodgball. His experience was the key to his success.
- The fearless Alison Bertsch would use her strength and deflections as her part of her strategy.
- Powerhouse monster Kevin Fitzpatrick was a sure odds-on favorite to win; brute force, swift dodges, among many of his other talents.
- Rounding out the five would be veteran Diana DiBuccio, with the use of her hands would be her biggest asset.

The legendary John Tronolone started off as only he would have liked, securing the first two games of the first-ever Fatal Five-Way Elimination match-up. But his first victories were short lived as nemesis Kevin Fitzpatrick won the third and fourth games, tying it up with Tronolone. The next game however would favor John once again, taking the fifth battle royal game and improving his score to 3. But "Fitz" was no where near finished with his rival. He'd pick up his third win also taking game 6. Would the final battle prove one man's superiority?

In the final game of DODGEBALL 62, neither John nor Fitz would walk away victorious. Prodigy Jim Martin woud instead take home the gold, coming out the final winner of the 62nd dodgeball spectacular.

Simplified Version of the Battle Royal
Game 1: John wins
Game 2: John wins
Game 3: "Fitz" wins
Game 4: "Fitz wins
Game 5: John wins
Game 6: "Fitz" wins
Game 7: Jim wins

John Tronolone and Kevin Fitzpatrick tied in the Fatal Five-Way Dodgeball Battle Royal at DODGEBALL 62, both earning 3 victories. Jim Martin placed runner-up with 1 win. Neither Alison nor Diana earned a victory.

DODGEBALL LX3: WAR
How odd that DODGEBALL 62 was billed as "The Calm before the Storm". It appears as if that may have been true. But now it's on to serious business as dodgeball is set to be invaded come this Saturday night, November the 11th.

It is no secret that for weeks, even months, the dodgeball website and more-so dodgeball's own, has been verbally attacked by a bunch of unknowns. The one question perhaps on everyones' mind is Who can it be?

It appears as if the answer to that will remain a mystery, at least until LX3.

Any developments to this story will be posted as soon as possible. Those that plan on attending, it is urged that you frequently check the dodgeball website, here at dodgeball.livejournal.com.
